document.heading: Corporation Franchise Tax Amendment Act of 1986

history.narrative: Law 6-129, the “Corporation Franchise Tax Amendment Act of 1986,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-352, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 15, 1986 and April 29, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 16, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-165 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
